thesis.title: Particle orientations in sheared suspensions.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: An investigation into the mechanism of shear failure exhibited by clay soils and the effect upon lt of variation in the rate of applied shear strain. The soils used in the investigation were prepared from the refined clay minerals attapulgite and kaolin, with the initial fabric controlled by variation in the counter-ion concentration in the pore fluid and stress history of the specimens. The techniques used included X-radiography and polarizing microscopy as well as more conventional methods such as the direct measurement of pore water migration and normal shrinkage ratios. lt was found that the shearing process caused a reorientation of the particles such that their long axes became parallel to the shear plane. Concurrent with this realignment it was found that an appreciable densification occurred within the volume adjacent to the shear plane.

thesis.subject: Soil mechanics
thesis.title: The rate dependent mechanism of shear failure in clay soils.

thesis.description: The application of precisely timed, short exposures of embryos to specific metabolic inbibitors is a useful method for analysing the biochemical aspects of development. The teratologic approach to the study of the biochemical requirerments of various organogenetic processes in the developing embryo was first formulated by Warkany (1944) who showed that the offspring of female rats maintained on a vitamin A deficient diet had characteristic patterns of malformations. [...]

thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The Mattagami Lake mine deposit is a zinc and copper-bearing pyritiferous deposit emplaced in a thick volcanic pile at the contact of pyroclastic rhyodacite and effusive andesite. In its geological setting and mineralogy it is similar to many other deposits in North America, e.g. the Horne and Lake Dufault mines of the Noranda camp, flin flan, Geco mine, Buchans, the deposits of Shasta County, California and the Verde mine, Arizona. Comparable deposits are found in the Calidonides of Norway, in the Urals, Spain, Cyprus and Japan. [...]
